ARABIC: وَحَرَٰمٌ عَلَىٰ قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَٰهَآ أَنَّهُمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: There is a ban on any city We have destroyed; they will not return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: It is imperative that a habitation We have destroyed will not desist (from unbelief)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: It has been ordained against every town that We ever destroyed that they shall not return (to enjoy a new lease of life)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The people whom We destroyed can never return to this world
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And it is forbidden for any township which We have destroyed, that they may return. (Once the disbelievers face death, their return to earth is impossible.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And a ban is laid on every town which We have destroyed that they shall not return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And it is binding on a town which We destroy that they shall not return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: There is a ban upon any city that We have destroyed; they shall not return
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And there is a ban upon any community which We have destroyed: that they shall not return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: It is ordained that no nation We have destroyed shall ever rise again,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And a ban is laid on every town which We have destroyed, that they Shall not return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: It is forbidden for [the people of] any town that We have destroyed [to return to the world]: they shall not return,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But there is a ban on any population which We have destroyed: that they shall not return,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And a ban is laid on every town (population) which We have destroyed that they shall not return (to this world again, nor repent to Us).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: (It is ordained that) no village We have destroyed shall return
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: There is a ban on the town that We had destroyed—that they will not return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And there is prohibition upon [the people of] a city which We have destroyed that they will [ever] return
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:95] It is forbidden for any town, meaning [it is forbidden for] its people, which We have destroyed that they should (lā yarji‘ūna: the lā is extra) return, that is, their return to this world is prohibited.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And there is a ban upon) an absence of success for (any community) for the people of Mecca: Abu Jahl and his host (which We have destroyed) which We have forsaken through their disbelief: (that they shall not return) to faith from their disbelief; it is also said that the verse means: it is forbidden for the people of Mecca, whom We have destroyed on the Day of Badr through killing them, to return to this worldly life,
